{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Congestion Charge and Low Emissions Zone factsheets"}

These factsheets include information about how many people pay the
        Congestion Charge (CC) and the Low Emission Zone (LEZ) charge and the number of
        Penalty Charge Notices that are issued.

The zone maps can be downloaded in pdf format from this page or you can view the interactive Low Emission Zone map.

The downloadable maps below are a web version of the Deposited Plans and are provided as a resource to help explain the Scheme. The Low Emission Zone is shaded green (rather than stippled) in the downloadable maps for clarity. The formal Deposited Plans are available to view on request.

The Mayor has asked TfL to prioritise the implementation of the ULEZ as part of our five-year £800 million plan to transform London's air quality.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Central London ULEZ"}

TfL is still working with its suppliers to finalise all costs as well as updating income projections for the central London ULEZ but estimates that this will be around £38 million for implementation costs.  There will also be annual operating costs which are estimated to be £13 million over 5 years from 2017/18 to 2021/22. There is also estimated to be about £55 million in gross income over the same period.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"ULEZ expansion up to the North/South circular roads"}

The proposal to expand ULEZ is open for consultation until 28 February 2018 and TfL is still in the process of designing how the ULEZ extension would operate. TfL will not have detailed implementation costs until later in the scheme's development. However, for the purposes of business planning TfL has estimated implementation costs of £90m-£130 million. There will also be annual operating costs and TfL is developing estimates for these.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Tightening LEZ standards"}

The proposal to tighten the LEZ standards for heavy vehicles in 2020 is open for consultation until 28 February 2018. TfL will not have detailed implementation costs until later in the scheme's development. However, for the purposes of business planning TfL has estimated implementation costs of £5-10 million. There will also be annual operating costs and TfL is still developing estimates for these.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"T-Charge"}

The T-Charge that was implemented in October 2017 cost £14 million in implementation costs with £1 million in operational costs for 2 years (after which T-Charge is replaced by the ULEZ). We currently project total T-Charge revenues of roughly £7 million.
